photo.description: The Church of the Madeleine is at the kend of Rue Royale in Paris, a street that bisects the north end of Place de la Concorde. It was intended by Napoleon as a temple to the glory of his Grande Armée (Grand Army). After the Restoration of the French monarchy, the structure was redesigned as a church, and was finally consecrated in 1845.
photo.tags: paris church madeleine france 1960 temple rueroyale placedelaconcorde concorde église
photo.title: Paris - Church of the Madeleine

photo.tags: instagramapp square squareformat iphoneography uploaded:by=instagram lofi foursquare:venue=4adcda09f964a520013421e3
photo.title: Nacimiento posmoderno en La Madeleine...

photo.tags: instagramapp square squareformat iphoneography uploaded:by=instagram rise foursquare:venue=4adcda09f964a520013421e3
photo.title: Not really ancien Rome but Paris ! La Madeleine..

photo.description: After passing Place de la Concorde, our coach heading straight north up Rue Royale towards the Church of the Madeleine. modeled after a greek temple, it was began in 1764, but consecrated as a church until 1845. In French it is the Église de la Madeleine. (English it's the Church of the Madeleine). L'église de la Madeleine (more formally, L'église Sainte-Marie-Madeleine; less formally, just La Madeleine), Madeleine Church in English, is a Roman Catholic church occupying a commanding position in the 8th arrondissement of Paris. It was designed in its present form as a temple to the glory of Napoleon's army. To its south lies the Place de la Concorde, to the east is the Place Vendôme, and to the west L'église Saint-Augustin. It is in Place de la Madeleine.
photo.tags: paris france lamadeleine iledefrance coach eglisedelamadeleine churchofthemadeleine placedelaconcorde rueroyale léglisedelamadeleine léglisesaintemariemadeleine lamadeliene madaleinechurch romancatholicchurch templetothegloryofnapoleonsarmy placevendôme léglisesaintaugustin relief basrelief column placedelamadeleine
photo.title: La Madeleine - Paris

photo.description: After passing Place de la Concorde, our coach heading straight north up Rue Royale towards the Church of the Madeleine. modeled after a greek temple, it was began in 1764, but consecrated as a church until 1845. In French it is the Église de la Madeleine. (English it's the Church of the Madeleine). L'église de la Madeleine (more formally, L'église Sainte-Marie-Madeleine; less formally, just La Madeleine), Madeleine Church in English, is a Roman Catholic church occupying a commanding position in the 8th arrondissement of Paris. It was designed in its present form as a temple to the glory of Napoleon's army. To its south lies the Place de la Concorde, to the east is the Place Vendôme, and to the west L'église Saint-Augustin. It is in Place de la Madeleine.

photo.title: L'église de la Madeleine

photo.description: Construída a partir do modelo da Maison Carré em Nímes, a Madeleine foi mandada fazer por Napoleão I em honra da Grande Armada. Entregou a obra ao arquiteto Vigneon em 1806. Em 1814 foi transformada numa igreja dedicada a S. Maria Madalena. Possui a forma de um templo grego clássico, ou seja, tem base ampla, escadaria e uma colunata de 52 colunas coríntias de 20 metros de altura. O frontão apresenta um friso esculpido por Lemaire em 1834, que representa o Juízo Universal.
photo.tags: eglisedelamadeleine igrejadesantamadalena igrejasantamariamadeleine santamadalena templogrego
photo.title: Eglise De La Madeleine.

photo.description: La iglesia de la Madeleine es un templo católico de estilo neoclásico situado en París (francia), concretamente a algunos metros de la Plaza de la Concordia (Concorde), en una zona muy comercial de alto nivel (al lado de la calle Faubourg-Saint-Honoré, una de las más comerciales de París). La iglesia de la Madeleine llama la atención por su arquitectura en forma de templo romano, inspirado en la Maison Carée de Nimes. (Fuente: Wikipedia)

photo.description: Projetada no estilo de um templo grego, em 1764, cercada por 52 colunas coríntias. A Igreja da Madalena (em francês: Église de la Madeleine), situada perto da Praça da Concórdia, em Paris, na França, é uma igreja católica consagrada a Santa Maria Madalena. Se destaca pela arquitetura em forma de templo clássico grego. A construção começou próxima do ano 1764 por Contant d´Ivry, sendo logo refeita com planos de Guillaume Couture (1777). Durante a Revolução Francesa, as obras foram suspensas de 1790 a 1805. Em 1806, por conta da tendência anticlerical da época, se transformou em um templo em homenagem ao Grande Exército, função que desempenhou até a construção do Arco do Triunfo, que a substituiu nessa função. Em 1842, foi consagrada como igreja católica, função que continua desempenhando na atualidade.

photo.description: Constructed in 1842 by King Louis-Philippe after nearly 100 years of fitful starts, (including interruptions by the French Revolution and the Napoleonic Wars) the Neoclassical La Madeleine was the scene of Chopin's funeral in 1840. Though it remains an active church, patrons may dine in the church after paying an annual subscription fee. 8th arrondissement, Paris, Île-de-France, France
